Social media are a business-to-business advertising platform in which everybody can throw their sales pitch to sell everything they want, included their entitlement, and where there is no room for wary potential clients: either you like one’s product straight away or you better leave them alone. The most resonant aspect of social networks are the rabid insults against everybody in disagreement; and disagreement equals more often than not to frustration from lack of appraisal: it's frustration erected to philosophy and system. Everybody can do and say what they want, shielded by virtuality which by definition doesn't even exist, but we must realize that the circle of friends should not be considered within the followers that in a moment of stupidity click a like button (if you are my "friend" or social equal you must like what I say...). The friends in life are built by subtraction, because the aim is to leave less and less, but the best possible ones. Exactly the opposite of what happens in social networks. So, to me, social media are definitely a mere promotional tool: some promote their business, few promote their personality, the majority promote their virtual self.

A lot depends upon the community. The more the community members are on the same page of their own understanding about the purpose of being social through virtual media, the more social will be the orientation of Social Media. It will rather be lesser an audience mapping tool for businesses. Being social is a method of interaction with other living entities which essentially leads to exchange of thoughts and ideas, thought provocation with excitement of existing interest, introduction to more interests, and an action in a geo-physical space that envisions to makes life easier, happier, and purposeful, in short term or long term. The nature, impact and extent of the action may be relative, depending upon the level of excitement. Being social in principle was supposed to give a boost to our own realization of being a part of a society where there is acceptance, cooperation and exchange of constructive ideas. As long as the element of ‘action’ remains and keeps on happening through social media, we can say social media is really social.

To be social or to socialize means having one-on-one conversations and contributing to the rumble of small talk at gatherings. It demands that one be physically present.  Speaking out loud, understanding body language, learning how to listen, respond, retain and relate are the constructs of socializing and foundational skills that deserve time and attention.
